25namespace webrtc {
26
27static const char kTimerQueueName[] = "AudioDeviceBufferTimer";
28
29// Time between two sucessive calls to LogStats().
30static const size_t kTimerIntervalInSeconds = 10;
31static const size_t kTimerIntervalInMilliseconds =
32 kTimerIntervalInSeconds * rtc::kNumMillisecsPerSec;
33// Min time required to qualify an audio session as a "call". If playout or
34// recording has been active for less than this time we will not store any
35// logs or UMA stats but instead consider the call as too short.
36static const size_t kMinValidCallTimeTimeInSeconds = 10;
37static const size_t kMinValidCallTimeTimeInMilliseconds =
38 kMinValidCallTimeTimeInSeconds * rtc::kNumMillisecsPerSec;
39#ifdef AUDIO_DEVICE_PLAYS_SINUS_TONE
40static const double k2Pi = 6.28318530717959;
41#endif
42
43AudioDeviceBuffer::AudioDeviceBuffer(TaskQueueFactory* task_queue_factory)
44 : task_queue_(task_queue_factory->CreateTaskQueue(
45 kTimerQueueName,
46 TaskQueueFactory::Priority::NORMAL)),
47 audio_transport_cb_(nullptr),
48 rec_sample_rate_(0),
49 play_sample_rate_(0),
50 rec_channels_(0),
51 play_channels_(0),
52 playing_(false),
53 recording_(false),
54 typing_status_(false),
55 play_delay_ms_(0),
56 rec_delay_ms_(0),
57 num_stat_reports_(0),
58 last_timer_task_time_(0),
59 rec_stat_count_(0),
60 play_stat_count_(0),
61 play_start_time_(0),
62 only_silence_recorded_(true),
63 log_stats_(false) {
64 RTC_LOG(INFO) << "AudioDeviceBuffer::ctor";
65#ifdef AUDIO_DEVICE_PLAYS_SINUS_TONE
66 phase_ = 0.0;
67 RTC_LOG(WARNING) << "AUDIO_DEVICE_PLAYS_SINUS_TONE is defined!";
68#endif
69}
70
71AudioDeviceBuffer::~AudioDeviceBuffer() {
72 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(&main_thread_checker_);
73 RTC_DCHECK(!playing_);
74 RTC_DCHECK(!recording_);
75 RTC_LOG(INFO) << "AudioDeviceBuffer::~dtor";
76}
77
78int32_t AudioDeviceBuffer::RegisterAudioCallback(
79 AudioTransport* audio_callback) {
80 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(&main_thread_checker_);
81 RTC_DLOG(INFO) << __FUNCTION__;
82 if (playing_ || recording_) {
83 RTC_LOG(LS_ERROR) << "Failed to set audio transport since media was active";
84 return -1;
85 }
86 audio_transport_cb_ = audio_callback;
87 return 0;
88}
89
90void AudioDeviceBuffer::StartPlayout() {
91 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(&main_thread_checker_);
92 // TODO(henrika): allow for usage of DCHECK(!playing_) here instead. Today the
93 // ADM allows calling Start(), Start() by ignoring the second call but it
94 // makes more sense to only allow one call.
95 if (playing_) {
96 return;
97 }
98 RTC_DLOG(INFO) << __FUNCTION__;
99 // Clear members tracking playout stats and do it on the task queue.
100 task_queue_.PostTask([this] { ResetPlayStats(); });
101 // Start a periodic timer based on task queue if not already done by the
102 // recording side.
103 if (!recording_) {
104 StartPeriodicLogging();
105 }
106 const int64_t now_time = rtc::TimeMillis();
107 // Clear members that are only touched on the main (creating) thread.
108 play_start_time_ = now_time;
109 playing_ = true;
110}
111
112void AudioDeviceBuffer::StartRecording() {
113 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(&main_thread_checker_);
114 if (recording_) {
115 return;
116 }
117 RTC_DLOG(INFO) << __FUNCTION__;
118 // Clear members tracking recording stats and do it on the task queue.
119 task_queue_.PostTask([this] { ResetRecStats(); });
120 // Start a periodic timer based on task queue if not already done by the
121 // playout side.
122 if (!playing_) {
123 StartPeriodicLogging();
124 }
125 // Clear members that will be touched on the main (creating) thread.
126 rec_start_time_ = rtc::TimeMillis();
127 recording_ = true;
128 // And finally a member which can be modified on the native audio thread.
129 // It is safe to do so since we know by design that the owning ADM has not
130 // yet started the native audio recording.
131 only_silence_recorded_ = true;
132}
133
134void AudioDeviceBuffer::StopPlayout() {
135 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(&main_thread_checker_);
136 if (!playing_) {
137 return;
138 }
139 RTC_DLOG(INFO) << __FUNCTION__;
140 playing_ = false;
141 // Stop periodic logging if no more media is active.
142 if (!recording_) {
143 StopPeriodicLogging();
144 }
145 RTC_LOG(INFO) << "total playout time: " << rtc::TimeSince(play_start_time_);
146}
147
148void AudioDeviceBuffer::StopRecording() {
149 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(&main_thread_checker_);
150 if (!recording_) {
151 return;
152 }
153 RTC_DLOG(INFO) << __FUNCTION__;
154 recording_ = false;
155 // Stop periodic logging if no more media is active.
156 if (!playing_) {
157 StopPeriodicLogging();
158 }
159 // Add UMA histogram to keep track of the case when only zeros have been
160 // recorded. Measurements (max of absolute level) are taken twice per second,
161 // which means that if e.g 10 seconds of audio has been recorded, a total of
162 // 20 level estimates must all be identical to zero to trigger the histogram.
163 // |only_silence_recorded_| can only be cleared on the native audio thread
164 // that drives audio capture but we know by design that the audio has stopped
165 // when this method is called, hence there should not be aby conflicts. Also,
166 // the fact that |only_silence_recorded_| can be affected during the complete
167 // call makes chances of conflicts with potentially one last callback very
168 // small.
169 const size_t time_since_start = rtc::TimeSince(rec_start_time_);
170 if (time_since_start > kMinValidCallTimeTimeInMilliseconds) {
171 const int only_zeros = static_cast<int>(only_silence_recorded_);
172 RTC_HISTOGRAM_BOOLEAN("WebRTC.Audio.RecordedOnlyZeros", only_zeros);
173 RTC_LOG(INFO) << "HISTOGRAM(WebRTC.Audio.RecordedOnlyZeros): "
174 << only_zeros;
175 }
176 RTC_LOG(INFO) << "total recording time: " << time_since_start;
177}
178
179int32_t AudioDeviceBuffer::SetRecordingSampleRate(uint32_t fsHz) {
180 RTC_LOG(INFO) << "SetRecordingSampleRate(" << fsHz << ")";
181 rec_sample_rate_ = fsHz;
182 return 0;
183}
184
185int32_t AudioDeviceBuffer::SetPlayoutSampleRate(uint32_t fsHz) {
186 RTC_LOG(INFO) << "SetPlayoutSampleRate(" << fsHz << ")";
187 play_sample_rate_ = fsHz;
188 return 0;
189}
190
191uint32_t AudioDeviceBuffer::RecordingSampleRate() const {
192 return rec_sample_rate_;
193}
194
195uint32_t AudioDeviceBuffer::PlayoutSampleRate() const {
196 return play_sample_rate_;
197}

200 RTC_LOG(INFO) << "SetRecordingChannels(" << channels << ")";
201 rec_channels_ = channels;
202 return 0;
203}
204
205int32_t AudioDeviceBuffer::SetPlayoutChannels(size_t channels) {
206 RTC_LOG(INFO) << "SetPlayoutChannels(" << channels << ")";
207 play_channels_ = channels;
208 return 0;
209}

211size_t AudioDeviceBuffer::RecordingChannels() const {
212 return rec_channels_;
213}

215size_t AudioDeviceBuffer::PlayoutChannels() const {
216 return play_channels_;

219int32_t AudioDeviceBuffer::SetTypingStatus(bool typing_status) {
220 typing_status_ = typing_status;
221 return 0;
222}
223
224void AudioDeviceBuffer::SetVQEData(int play_delay_ms, int rec_delay_ms) {
225 play_delay_ms_ = play_delay_ms;
226 rec_delay_ms_ = rec_delay_ms;
227}
228
229int32_t AudioDeviceBuffer::SetRecordedBuffer(const void* audio_buffer,
230 size_t samples_per_channel) {
231 // Copy the complete input buffer to the local buffer.
232 const size_t old_size = rec_buffer_.size();
233 rec_buffer_.SetData(static_cast<const int16_t*>(audio_buffer),
234 rec_channels_ * samples_per_channel);
235 // Keep track of the size of the recording buffer. Only updated when the
236 // size changes, which is a rare event.
237 if (old_size != rec_buffer_.size()) {
238 RTC_LOG(LS_INFO) << "Size of recording buffer: " << rec_buffer_.size();
239 }
240
241 // Derive a new level value twice per second and check if it is non-zero.
242 int16_t max_abs = 0;
243 RTC_DCHECK_LT(rec_stat_count_, 50);
244 if (++rec_stat_count_ >= 50) {
245 // Returns the largest absolute value in a signed 16-bit vector.
246 max_abs = WebRtcSpl_MaxAbsValueW16(rec_buffer_.data(), rec_buffer_.size());
247 rec_stat_count_ = 0;
248 // Set |only_silence_recorded_| to false as soon as at least one detection
249 // of a non-zero audio packet is found. It can only be restored to true
250 // again by restarting the call.
251 if (max_abs > 0) {
252 only_silence_recorded_ = false;
253 }
254 }
255 // Update recording stats which is used as base for periodic logging of the
256 // audio input state.
257 UpdateRecStats(max_abs, samples_per_channel);
258 return 0;
259}
260
261int32_t AudioDeviceBuffer::DeliverRecordedData() {
262 if (!audio_transport_cb_) {
263 RTC_LOG(LS_WARNING) << "Invalid audio transport";
264 return 0;
265 }
266 const size_t frames = rec_buffer_.size() / rec_channels_;
267 const size_t bytes_per_frame = rec_channels_ * sizeof(int16_t);
268 uint32_t new_mic_level_dummy = 0;
269 uint32_t total_delay_ms = play_delay_ms_ + rec_delay_ms_;
270 int32_t res = audio_transport_cb_->RecordedDataIsAvailable(
271 rec_buffer_.data(), frames, bytes_per_frame, rec_channels_,
272 rec_sample_rate_, total_delay_ms, 0, 0, typing_status_,
273 new_mic_level_dummy);
274 if (res == -1) {
275 RTC_LOG(LS_ERROR) << "RecordedDataIsAvailable() failed";
276 }
277 return 0;
278}
279
280int32_t AudioDeviceBuffer::RequestPlayoutData(size_t samples_per_channel) {
281 // The consumer can change the requested size on the fly and we therefore
282 // resize the buffer accordingly. Also takes place at the first call to this
283 // method.
284 const size_t total_samples = play_channels_ * samples_per_channel;
285 if (play_buffer_.size() != total_samples) {
286 play_buffer_.SetSize(total_samples);
287 RTC_LOG(LS_INFO) << "Size of playout buffer: " << play_buffer_.size();
288 }
289
290 size_t num_samples_out(0);
291 // It is currently supported to start playout without a valid audio
292 // transport object. Leads to warning and silence.
293 if (!audio_transport_cb_) {
294 RTC_LOG(LS_WARNING) << "Invalid audio transport";
295 return 0;
296 }
297
298 // Retrieve new 16-bit PCM audio data using the audio transport instance.
299 int64_t elapsed_time_ms = -1;
300 int64_t ntp_time_ms = -1;
301 const size_t bytes_per_frame = play_channels_ * sizeof(int16_t);
302 uint32_t res = audio_transport_cb_->NeedMorePlayData(
303 samples_per_channel, bytes_per_frame, play_channels_, play_sample_rate_,
304 play_buffer_.data(), num_samples_out, &elapsed_time_ms, &ntp_time_ms);
305 if (res != 0) {
306 RTC_LOG(LS_ERROR) << "NeedMorePlayData() failed";
307 }
308
309 // Derive a new level value twice per second.
310 int16_t max_abs = 0;
311 RTC_DCHECK_LT(play_stat_count_, 50);
312 if (++play_stat_count_ >= 50) {
313 // Returns the largest absolute value in a signed 16-bit vector.
314 max_abs =
315 WebRtcSpl_MaxAbsValueW16(play_buffer_.data(), play_buffer_.size());
316 play_stat_count_ = 0;
317 }
318 // Update playout stats which is used as base for periodic logging of the
319 // audio output state.
320 UpdatePlayStats(max_abs, num_samples_out / play_channels_);
321 return static_cast<int32_t>(num_samples_out / play_channels_);
322}
323
324int32_t AudioDeviceBuffer::GetPlayoutData(void* audio_buffer) {
325 RTC_DCHECK_GT(play_buffer_.size(), 0);
326#ifdef AUDIO_DEVICE_PLAYS_SINUS_TONE
327 const double phase_increment =
328 k2Pi * 440.0 / static_cast<double>(play_sample_rate_);
329 int16_t* destination_r = reinterpret_cast<int16_t*>(audio_buffer);
330 if (play_channels_ == 1) {
331 for (size_t i = 0; i < play_buffer_.size(); ++i) {
332 destination_r[i] = static_cast<int16_t>((sin(phase_) * (1 << 14)));
333 phase_ += phase_increment;
334 }
335 } else if (play_channels_ == 2) {
336 for (size_t i = 0; i < play_buffer_.size() / 2; ++i) {
337 destination_r[2 * i] = destination_r[2 * i + 1] =
338 static_cast<int16_t>((sin(phase_) * (1 << 14)));
339 phase_ += phase_increment;
340 }
341 }
342#else
343 memcpy(audio_buffer, play_buffer_.data(),
344 play_buffer_.size() * sizeof(int16_t));
345#endif
346 // Return samples per channel or number of frames.
347 return static_cast<int32_t>(play_buffer_.size() / play_channels_);
348}
349
350void AudioDeviceBuffer::StartPeriodicLogging() {
351 task_queue_.PostTask([this] { LogStats(AudioDeviceBuffer::LOG_START); });
352}
353
354void AudioDeviceBuffer::StopPeriodicLogging() {
355 task_queue_.PostTask([this] { LogStats(AudioDeviceBuffer::LOG_STOP); });
356}
357
358void AudioDeviceBuffer::LogStats(LogState state) {
359 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(&task_queue_);
360 int64_t now_time = rtc::TimeMillis();
361
362 if (state == AudioDeviceBuffer::LOG_START) {
363 // Reset counters at start. We will not add any logging in this state but
364 // the timer will started by posting a new (delayed) task.
365 num_stat_reports_ = 0;
366 last_timer_task_time_ = now_time;
367 log_stats_ = true;
368 } else if (state == AudioDeviceBuffer::LOG_STOP) {
369 // Stop logging and posting new tasks.
370 log_stats_ = false;
371 } else if (state == AudioDeviceBuffer::LOG_ACTIVE) {
372 // Keep logging unless logging was disabled while task was posted.
373 }
374
375 // Avoid adding more logs since we are in STOP mode.
376 if (!log_stats_) {
377 return;
378 }
379
380 int64_t next_callback_time = now_time + kTimerIntervalInMilliseconds;
381 int64_t time_since_last = rtc::TimeDiff(now_time, last_timer_task_time_);
382 last_timer_task_time_ = now_time;
383
384 Stats stats;
385 {
386 MutexLock lock(&lock_);
387 stats = stats_;
388 stats_.max_rec_level = 0;
389 stats_.max_play_level = 0;
390 }
391
392 // Cache current sample rate from atomic members.
393 const uint32_t rec_sample_rate = rec_sample_rate_;
394 const uint32_t play_sample_rate = play_sample_rate_;
395
396 // Log the latest statistics but skip the first two rounds just after state
397 // was set to LOG_START to ensure that we have at least one full stable
398 // 10-second interval for sample-rate estimation. Hence, first printed log
399 // will be after ~20 seconds.
400 if (++num_stat_reports_ > 2 &&
401 static_cast<size_t>(time_since_last) > kTimerIntervalInMilliseconds / 2) {
402 uint32_t diff_samples = stats.rec_samples - last_stats_.rec_samples;
403 float rate = diff_samples / (static_cast<float>(time_since_last) / 1000.0);
404 uint32_t abs_diff_rate_in_percent = 0;
405 if (rec_sample_rate > 0 && rate > 0) {
406 abs_diff_rate_in_percent = static_cast<uint32_t>(
407 0.5f +
408 ((100.0f * std::abs(rate - rec_sample_rate)) / rec_sample_rate));
409 RTC_HISTOGRAM_PERCENTAGE("WebRTC.Audio.RecordSampleRateOffsetInPercent",
410 abs_diff_rate_in_percent);
411 RTC_LOG(INFO) << "[REC : " << time_since_last << "msec, "
412 << rec_sample_rate / 1000 << "kHz] callbacks: "
413 << stats.rec_callbacks - last_stats_.rec_callbacks
414 << ", "
415 "samples: "
416 << diff_samples
417 << ", "
418 "rate: "
419 << static_cast<int>(rate + 0.5)
420 << ", "
421 "rate diff: "
422 << abs_diff_rate_in_percent
423 << "%, "
424 "level: "
425 << stats.max_rec_level;
426 }
427
428 diff_samples = stats.play_samples - last_stats_.play_samples;
429 rate = diff_samples / (static_cast<float>(time_since_last) / 1000.0);
430 abs_diff_rate_in_percent = 0;
431 if (play_sample_rate > 0 && rate > 0) {
432 abs_diff_rate_in_percent = static_cast<uint32_t>(
433 0.5f +
434 ((100.0f * std::abs(rate - play_sample_rate)) / play_sample_rate));
435 RTC_HISTOGRAM_PERCENTAGE("WebRTC.Audio.PlayoutSampleRateOffsetInPercent",
436 abs_diff_rate_in_percent);
437 RTC_LOG(INFO) << "[PLAY: " << time_since_last << "msec, "
438 << play_sample_rate / 1000 << "kHz] callbacks: "
439 << stats.play_callbacks - last_stats_.play_callbacks
440 << ", "
441 "samples: "
442 << diff_samples
443 << ", "
444 "rate: "
445 << static_cast<int>(rate + 0.5)
446 << ", "
447 "rate diff: "
448 << abs_diff_rate_in_percent
449 << "%, "
450 "level: "
451 << stats.max_play_level;
452 }
453 }
454 last_stats_ = stats;
455
456 int64_t time_to_wait_ms = next_callback_time - rtc::TimeMillis();
457 RTC_DCHECK_GT(time_to_wait_ms, 0) << "Invalid timer interval";
458
459 // Keep posting new (delayed) tasks until state is changed to kLogStop.
460 task_queue_.PostDelayedTask(
461 [this] { AudioDeviceBuffer::LogStats(AudioDeviceBuffer::LOG_ACTIVE); },
462 time_to_wait_ms);
463}
464
465void AudioDeviceBuffer::ResetRecStats() {
466 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(&task_queue_);
467 last_stats_.ResetRecStats();
468 MutexLock lock(&lock_);
469 stats_.ResetRecStats();
470}
471
472void AudioDeviceBuffer::ResetPlayStats() {
473 RTC_DCHECK_RUN_ON(&task_queue_);
474 last_stats_.ResetPlayStats();
475 MutexLock lock(&lock_);
476 stats_.ResetPlayStats();
477}
478
479void AudioDeviceBuffer::UpdateRecStats(int16_t max_abs,
480 size_t samples_per_channel) {
481 MutexLock lock(&lock_);
482 ++stats_.rec_callbacks;
483 stats_.rec_samples += samples_per_channel;
484 if (max_abs > stats_.max_rec_level) {
485 stats_.max_rec_level = max_abs;
486 }
487}
488
489void AudioDeviceBuffer::UpdatePlayStats(int16_t max_abs,
490 size_t samples_per_channel) {
491 MutexLock lock(&lock_);
492 ++stats_.play_callbacks;
493 stats_.play_samples += samples_per_channel;
494 if (max_abs > stats_.max_play_level) {
495 stats_.max_play_level = max_abs;
496 }
497}
